title: How did the Browns decide on starting QB No. 41? Inside their 'intentional' methods
content: The quarterbacks room has been developed to give Dillon Gabriel (named Sunday's starter) and Shedeur Sanders space to grow.

title: QB McCarthy out; Wentz starts with battered OL
content: Vikings quarterback J.J. McCarthy will miss his third consecutive start because of a high right ankle sprain, turning once again to Carson Wentz behind an offensive line missing multiple starters.

title: Source: Bucs RB Irving (foot) could miss 2 weeks
content: Buccaneers RB Bucky Irving is expected to miss Sunday's game at the Seahawks due to a foot sprain and there is also concern he could miss next week's game against the 49ers, a source told ESPN's Jeremy Fowler.

title: Source: Panthers' Hubbard not expected to play
content: Panthers running back Chuba Hubbard is not expected to play in Sunday's game against the Dolphins due to a calf injury that has kept him out of practice the past two days, a league source confirmed Friday.

title: Niners' Jones beats odds, lets it fly in career night
content: Battling through a sprained knee and cramping forearm, Mac Jones threw for 342 yards and two touchdowns to lead the Niners past the Rams 26-23 in overtime on Thursday night.

title: Bogaerts laments 'terrible' call, pines for ABS
content: Count Xander Bogaerts among those looking forward to Major League Baseball's new challenge system for balls and strikes next season. The San Diego Padres shortstop just wishes it were in place a little earlier.

title: Schlittler historic in 12-K gem as Yanks oust Sox
content: Rookie Cam Schlittler became the first pitcher in postseason history to go at least eight scoreless innings with 12-plus strikeouts and no walks, as the Yankees advanced to the ALDS with a 4-0 win over the Red Sox on Thursday night.

title: Ex-Braves catcher Ross interested in Atlanta job
content: David Ross, the former Braves catcher and Cubs manager, said Thursday that returning as manager of the Braves "would be amazing."

title: Nev. court rejects NFL plea for Gruden rehearing
content: Thursday's unanimous ruling by the Nevada Supreme Court means the last option for the NFL is to appeal to the U.S. Supreme Court, which sources told ESPN is likely.

title: 🎥 How The Rock transformed for new movie
content: Becoming Mark Kerr, a 6-foot-3, 260-pound ex-MMA fighter, included a process unlike any other during Johnson's acting career.

title: Niners pull out the win in back-and-forth game against Rams
content: The 49ers did not record an interception Thursday night -- their 12th game in a row without one -- but won.

title: Our guide to every Week 5 NFL game: Matchup previews, predictions, picks and nuggets
content: Here's everything you need to know. Which teams will win, who are the X factors, and which storylines matter most?

title: Another year, another set of struggles: Can Clemson, Dabo turn it around again?
content: Frustrations are high at Clemson. Dabo Swinney and former players aren't shying away from the issues.

title: The A'ja Wilson text that turned around the Aces' season -- and how Bam Adebayo helped craft it
content: The Aces had just lost by 53 points. A'ja Wilson delivered a message to her teammates. It sparked a 17-game win streak.

title: Ranking the top 15 players in the WNBA Finals
content: Las Vegas and Phoenix tip off the 2025 WNBA Finals on Friday. These will be the best players on the court.

title: Lapsed fan's guide to the NHL season: Biggest storylines, top contenders, key players to know
content: Miss anything the past few months? Miss everything? Get caught up here before opening night on Tuesday.

title: Last-minute pickups for Week 5: Jaxson Dart, Brenton Strange among top options
content: With many quality fantasy starters on byes this week, we have options at each position to fill in for you.

title: Paolo Banchero, Trae Young: Breaking down 10 names that could define NBA season
content: ESPN's Tim Bontemps breaks down players and personnel that will play major roles on the court and beyond.

title: Man United need to face reality: Amorim is not the club's biggest issue
content: Man United's decision-making is driven by the idea of where they think they ought to be, not where they are.

title: The time for experimentation is over: USMNT squad sees Pochettino's World Cup vision come into focus
content: Mauricio Pochettino has been experimenting with his USMNT lineup for some time, but judging by his October squad, his World Cup team is taking shape.

title: The new World Cup ball is here! How a century of evolution has led to 2026's Trionda
content: We look at every World Cup ball, from the first almost 100 years ago to the new Trionda that will be used in Canada, Mexico and the U.S. next summer.

title: Taylor Swift 10, Purdue 0: Can the Boilermakers break the 'curse' vs. Illinois?
content: Purdue is 4-11 in its first game after a Taylor Swift album drops -- and 0-10 when that game falls within seven days of a release.

title: Wetzel: Collier comments reflect WNBA's core problem: How it sees Caitlin Clark
content: In seeming to not embrace the player who singlehandedly lifted the WNBA, the league risks losing her fan base.

title: Barnwell's NFL quarter-season awards: The top candidates to win MVP, Rookie of the Year, more
content: Can Josh Allen win another MVP? Could anyone edge Myles Garrett for DPOY? We ranked the top three candidates to win seven NFL awards through four weeks.

title: Tottenham takeover: Top scenes from Vikings-Browns in London
content: The NFL went international in Week 5. Here's how Minnesota and Cleveland made the trip worth remembering in London.

title: Boxing real or not: Gervonta Davis' future, Teofimo-Shakur, more
content: Andreas Hale on what's next for Gervonta Davis after Jake Paul, Terence Crawford's next move and more.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Mexico's Mora on Arsenal, City, Madrid, Barça radar
content: Mexico teenager Gilberto Mora is being tracked by Arsenal, Manchester City, Real Madrid and Barcelona. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: 2026 class: Risers, teams with early edges, more
content: Which five-star recruits are still on the board? What to know with six weeks until the early signing window.

title: Women's Champions League preview: Team-by-team, talking points, predictions
content: The UEFA Women's Champions League is back with a new 18-team format, so what do you need to know about the teams and talking points?

title: Eric Karabell's 'Do not draft' list, including LaMelo Ball, Ja Morant, Joel Embiid
content: Eric Karabell highlights the players to fade at their current average draft position in fantasy basketball drafts.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Give me a reason to draft this guy! Late-round picks
content: When you're in the late rounds of your draft, here are the players you should look at and the key reason why.

title: 'Habit of shifting blame': India rebukes Yunus govt; rubbishes B'desh unrest claims
content: India strongly rejected Bangladesh's accusations. New Delhi denied involvement in recent Khagrachhari violence. Bangladesh's interim government blamed India for unrest. India urged Bangladesh to investigate local extremists. Clashes in Chittagong Hill Tracts left three dead. Violence followed protests over an alleged gang rape. Bangladesh linked unrest to Sheikh Hasina and India without evidence. India called allegations false and baseless.

title: Pak U-turn? FM Dar says Trump's Gaza plan 'not ours' - what has changed?
content: Pakistan has formally distanced itself from US President Trump's 20-point Gaza peace plan, with foreign minister Ishaq Dar stating the final proposal was not endorsed by Islamabad. Dar clarified that Pakistan, along with other Muslim and Arab nations, had submitted a counter-draft emphasizing an immediate ceasefire and complete Israeli withdrawal.

title: Yom Kippur synagogue attack in UK: Has Europe normalised Jew hatred — again?
content: Europe promised that such hatred would never return. But history does not move in straight lines. On Yom Kippur 2025, in Manchester, glass crunched again. Not on shopfronts, but beneath the wheels of a car that rammed into Jews outside their synagogue, followed by a stabbing rampage.

title: IND vs WI: 'Keep doing same things every day' - How Joe Root shaped Dhruv Jurel's batting
content: Wicketkeeper-batter Dhruv Jurel struck his maiden Test century on Friday, scoring 125 runs and forging a crucial 206-run partnership for the fifth wicket with Ravindra Jadeja, giving India a commanding lead against the West Indies. Jurel credited extensive visualisation and discipline for his readiness, also acknowledging mentorship from England's Joe Root.

title: PoK unrest: India flays Pak's 'oppressive approach'; flags 'horrific' violations
content: India's MEA condemned the "horrific" brutality by Pakistani forces on protestors in PoK, calling it a consequence of Pakistan's oppressive rule and resource plundering. Widespread protests, demanding reforms and basic necessities, continued for a sixth day across PoJK, with Muzaffarabad as the epicentre, following reports of 10 deaths and many injuries.

title: H-1B visa debate heats up: US senator writes to TCS; questions on H-1B hiring
content: US Senators Charles Grassley and Richard Durbin have challenged Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) over its H-1B visa hiring practices amid significant global layoffs. A letter to CEO Krithi Krithivasan expresses concern about high American tech unemployment while TCS secured approval for 5,505 H-1B workers in FY2025, despite announcing 12,000 global job cuts.

title: 'Hideouts changing': IAF chief on terror camps in Pak; how Op Sindoor struck fear
content: IAF Chief A P Singh stated terrorist groups are relocating deeper into Pakistan post-Operation Sindoor, but India retains accurate deep-strike capabilities. He revealed Operation Sindoor destroyed 4-5 Pakistani fighter jets, damaged airfields, radars, and command centers, and hit other high-value targets, demonstrating India's effective response to terror.

title: 'Something fishy': Congress seeks 'truth' about Op Sindoor
content: Congress expressed doubt over "Operation Sindoor," citing conflicting statements from top defense officials and demanding clarity. Air Force chief Amar Preet Singh dismissed Pakistan's claims of downing Indian jets as "Manohar Kahaniyan," while India had shown evidence of damage to Pakistani targets. Earlier, CDS General Anil Chauhan had acknowledged initial Indian losses during the conflict.

title: Godfather of AI warns:Humanity at stake; AI chooses goals over lives
content: AI pioneer Yoshua Bengio warns humanity faces extinction within a decade as hyperintelligent machines prioritize their own survival over human life. He highlights AI systems already choosing programmed goals over human safety, capable of manipulation. With tech giants racing to develop advanced AI, Bengio urges independent oversight, launching LawZero to ensure safety protocols.

title: Sam Bennett net worth: Florida Panthers star’s $20-30m value and $8m salary
content: Sam Bennett of the Florida Panthers has steadily built his reputation. As well as wealth in the NHL. From his early days with the Calgary Flames to a key role in Florida, his career growth is reflected in lucrative contracts, playoff success, and off-ice initiatives, his net worth of $20–$30 million and $8 million AAV contract show his financial rise.

title: IND vs WI: Home century drought ends! KL Rahul reveals new batting approach
content: KL Rahul ended a nine-year wait for a home Test century, scoring 100 against West Indies in Ahmedabad. This second home hundred in his career stems from a new batting approach, focusing on tempo and singles. Rahul, dedicating the milestone to his daughter, believes this signals a more consistent phase, combining elegance with efficiency crucial for India's home season.

title: US shutdown halts H-1B visas: Indian workers risks legal status; no end date
content: The US government shutdown, effective October 1, has brought H-1B visa processing to a standstill, severely impacting Indian professionals. The Department of Labor's closure prevents critical LCA approvals, freezing new applications, transfers, and green card processes. This indefinite halt, amid proposed fee hikes, creates significant uncertainty for thousands of high-skilled workers and businesses.

title: 'Justice within 3 yrs': Shah hails new criminal laws; impact on conviction rate
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah announced Haryana's conviction rate doubled to 80% under new criminal laws, targeting three-year case disposal post-2026. In Kurukshetra, he launched development projects, praising the state's BJP government. Later in Rohtak, Shah unveiled plans for 75,000 new dairy cooperatives, crediting the Modi administration for significantly boosting the khadi sector and India's dairy growth.

title: US layoffs to cross 1m? 950K jobs cut so far this year; shutdown may add to losses
content: The US economy faces over 1 million job losses in 2025, with 95,00,00 already by September, signaling a significant labour market slowdown. While substantial, these figures are below 2020 levels. The Federal Reserve has reduced interest rates by 0.25% and plans further cuts, aiming to stabilise the market amidst stagnation, rising costs, and technological changes, potentially boosting hiring prospects.

title: Taylor Swift’s ‘Opalite’: Love letter to Travis Kelce leaves fans mesmerised
content: Taylor Swift’s Opalite is more than a song, it’s a love letter to fiancé Travis Kelce. Inspired by his opal birthstone, the track blends heartbreak, healing, and devotion into a chorus about finding “opalite skies.” Fans can’t stop swooning over the way Swift sings about Kelce’s eyes and the life they’re building together. Oh, to be loved by a poet!

title: IND vs WI: 'Indian Army deserves it' - Jurel explains 'gun salute' century celebration
content: Dhruv Jurel marked his maiden Test hundred with 125 runs against West Indies in Ahmedabad, dedicating his century to the Indian army and his fifty to his father. He shared a crucial 206-run stand with Ravindra Jadeja, who remained unbeaten on 104. KL Rahul also scored 100, as India ended Day 2 strongly with a massive lead.

title: Why Indira didn’t let Rajiv attend two proposed meetings with Bhindranwale
content: A new book highlights how political interference and missed opportunities allowed Jarnail Singh Bhindranwale to escalate tensions before 1984. Indira Gandhi's attempts for Rajiv to secretly meet Bhindranwale failed twice due to safety concerns, infuriating him. These cancellations, coupled with his quick 1981 release, led to the tragic 1984 events.

title: Trump proposes 15% cap on international students: Enrolment dips; budgets strain
content: The US is already seeing a sharp drop in international student enrolment ahead of a proposed 15% cap, with visa delays and restrictive policies deterring applicants. Asian and African student numbers have plunged, particularly at the graduate level, hitting research programmes and university budgets. Institutions like DePaul are cutting costs amid falling revenues. The proposed cap, paired with a 5% per-country limit, formalises a trend already underway, risking major economic and academic repercussions.

title: Komal weds Lovish: 'Missing my brother' – Why Abhishek Sharma missed the wedding
content: Komal Sharma, sister of Indian cricketer Abhishek Sharma, tied the knot in Amritsar, expressing joy but also missing her brother. Abhishek was unable to attend due to national duty, representing India A against Australia A, where he unfortunately registered a golden duck, underscoring the sacrifices athletes make for their sport.

title: Nafisa Ali Sodhi’s grandkids help her cope with hair fall amid chemotherapy - see Pic
content: Veteran actor Nafisa Ali Sodhi, 68, is bravely battling Stage 4 peritoneal cancer, resuming chemotherapy with a positive outlook. She recently shared a heartwarming moment where her grandchildren lovingly helped her with hair loss caused by the treatment. This touching post garnered immense support and admiration from netizens, who hailed her as a warrior.

title: Wayne Gretzky and Janet Jones: Relationship timeline of 30-year marriage
content: Hockey legend Wayne Gretzky and Janet Jones' enduring love story began with a chance meeting in 1981, reigniting at a 1987 Lakers game. Their shared mindset led to a whirlwind romance, a "royal wedding" in 1988, and a family of five children. They prioritized family, making their decades-long marriage a true victory off the ice.

title: Karur stampede: SIT formed, rallies halted; what Madras HC said on CBI probe demand
content: The Madras high court formed a Special Investigation Team to probe the Karur stampede that killed 41, while temporarily banning political rallies on Tamil Nadu highways until Standard Operating Procedures are finalized. It also rejected a CBI probe plea and reserved orders on TVK functionaries' bail, directing action against an "inflammatory" tweet.

title: IND vs WI: KL Rahul - The monk who has now found his Ferrari in Test cricket
content: After years of flashes of brilliance and long periods of inconsistency, KL Rahul has finally found his rhythm in Test cricket. With assured knocks in England and a commanding start to India’s home season, the opener is turning potential into consistent performance, proving 2025 could be the defining year of his Test career.

title: Delhi 'godman' Chaitanyananda remanded to 14-day judicial custody in molesting case
content: Self-styled godman Swami Chaitanyananda Saraswati received 14 days judicial custody. He faces allegations of molesting 17 female students in Delhi. Police arrested him from Agra. Investigations revealed multiple bank accounts and over 50 lakh withdrawn after the FIR. Authorities froze 8 crore rupees. Fake United Nations and BRICS visiting cards were also found.

title: 'Importance of man': IAF chief on future of war; rubbishes Elon Musk's prediction
content: Indian Air Force Chief A P Singh dismissed Elon Musk's assertion that drones will replace manned aircraft, emphasizing the continued relevance of human pilots and collaborative manned-unmanned systems in future warfare. He also refuted Pakistan's "fanciful stories" about shooting down Indian jets during Operation Sindoor, challenging their lack of evidence.

title: Maria Sharapova on career-threatening injury: Why she refused to retire
content: Maria Sharapova refused to retire after her serious 2008 shoulder injury, driven by her profound love for tennis and her family's immense sacrifices. Despite missing nearly a year and her ranking plummeting, she made a remarkable comeback in 2009, winning a title and rapidly climbing the ranks. Her persistence stemmed from building her career from scratch.

title: Ameesha Patel reveals Indira Gandhi set her parents’ wedding date
content: Ameesha Patel, the star of 'Kaho Naa... Pyaar Hai', recently revealed fascinating details about her early life. She shared that Indira Gandhi personally set her parents' wedding date, and she grew up surrounded by iconic figures like Dev Anand and Dilip Kumar. Patel also disclosed prioritizing her acting career over a significant relationship before her Bollywood debut.

title: IND vs WI: Rahul, Jurel & Jadeja hit centuries; India dominate Windies on Day 2
content: India's top and middle order dominated Day 2 of the Test against West Indies, as KL Rahul, Dhruv Jurel, and Ravindra Jadeja all scored centuries. Rahul ended his home century drought, while Jurel and Jadeja forged a crucial partnership. India finished at 448/5, leading by 286 runs, poised for a Day 3 victory.

title: 'Anchor of stability': RBI guv hails India's growth story amid volatile world
content: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra and Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman affirmed India's economic stability and resilient growth at the Kautilya Economic Conclave 2025. They highlighted strong fundamentals, including low inflation and robust balance sheets, positioning India as a stabilising force amidst global turbulence and trade challenges, even with US tariffs.

title: Watch: Police raid Islamabad press club amid PoK protests; journalists assaulted
content: Protests in Pakistan-occupied Jammu and Kashmir escalated, leading to a shocking police raid on Islamabad's National Press Club. Journalists were injured and equipment vandalised, sparking nationwide outrage and a "Black Day" protest by unions. This incident occurred amidst ongoing PoK demonstrations demanding reforms, where several civilians have reportedly died due to police action, further intensifying the crisis.

title: IND vs WI: Dhruv Jurel hits maiden Test century - fifth Indian to do so vs West Indies
content: Dhruv Jurel achieved his first Test century. He scored 100 runs against West Indies. This happened in Ahmedabad. Jurel reached the milestone in his sixth Test match. He hit 12 fours and two sixes. Jurel is the 12th Indian wicketkeeper to score a Test ton. He is the fifth Indian to register a maiden hundred against West Indies.

title: 'Could look deep inside': IAF chief reveals 'longest kill' during Op Sindoor; details Pak losses
content: Indian Air Force Chief Amar Preet Singh discussed Operation Sindoor. He stated the four-day campaign achieved its objectives swiftly. India avenged innocent killings and brought Pakistan to its knees. Newly inducted long-range surface-to-air missiles were crucial. They achieved a 300 km kill. The media also helped manage disinformation during the conflict. India responded to the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: 'Drug kingpin': Ex-NSG commando held with 200kg ganja; was once part of 26/11 terror op
content: Former NSG commando Bajrang Singh, who participated in the 2008 Mumbai terror operation, was arrested in Rajasthan for allegedly masterminding a large-scale cannabis smuggling network. Police recovered 200kg of the drug, stating he was the kingpin transporting it from Telangana and Odisha. This arrest is a significant step against the terror-narcotics nexus.

title: 'India a global leader': Gates on Gandhi Jayanti; hails contribution to Global South
content: Billionaire Bill Gates honored Mahatma Gandhi's values at an event in Seattle, praising India's innovation and leadership in the Global South. He affirmed the Gates Foundation's continued partnership with India on its Viksit Bharat 2047 vision. This event, co-organised with the Indian Consulate, was part of widespread Gandhi Jayanti celebrations across United States.

title: IND vs WI: Jadeja shatters Dhoni's record; only three Indians ahead of him
content: Ravindra Jadeja surpassed MS Dhoni to become India's fourth-highest six-hitter in Test cricket during his unbeaten 50 against West Indies. His knock, featuring four sixes so far, took his tally to 79 in 86 Tests, contributing to a strong partnership with Dhruv Jurel. Jadeja is also having a remarkable year, nearing 4,000 Test runs and achieving his seventh fifty-plus score.

title: ‘Modi-a-bindu’: BJP’s 'diagnosis' for Rahul Gandhi
content: BJP MP Sudhanshu Trivedi criticized Rahul Gandhi, coining "Modi-a-bindu" to describe his alleged blindness to India's development. This came after Gandhi claimed in Colombia that Indian democracy is under attack and the country doesn't manufacture. Trivedi labeled Gandhi a "henchman of anti-India forces" for his foreign remarks against PM Modi, calling him the "biggest symbol of democracy."

title: Big 4 visa overhaul 2025: Higher costs, tighter routes; what Indians must know
content: n 2025, global student and work visa rules are tightening, reshaping opportunities for international talent. The US imposed a $100,000 H-1B fee and fixed-term student stays, Canada reduced study permits and limited spousal work rights, the UK raised living-cost proofs and shortened post-study work, while Australia overhauled English-test rules. These changes directly affect finances, career paths, and long-term plans.

title: 'Fake news': Yunus plays down violence against minorities in B'desh; rights group hits back
content: Bangladesh's interim leader Muhammad Yunus dismissed widespread reports of anti-Hindu violence as "fake news," accusing India of spreading misinformation. He insisted incidents were ordinary disputes, not religious persecution, advising Hindus to seek protection as citizens. This stance drew sharp criticism from minority groups, who accused him of denying the truth and backtracking on previous admissions.

title: 'Golden palace will burn': Congress leader Udit Raj takes 'Ravan' jibe at PM Modi
content: Congress leader Udit Raj ignited a political storm by calling Prime Minister Narendra Modi the “Ravana of Delhi,” predicting his imminent downfall. BJP's Shehzad Poonawala swiftly condemned these remarks, questioning the Congress party's intentions. Raj further commented on India's foreign policy challenges, including a Taliban minister's visit and US tariffs, while dismissing reports of internal party conflict in Karnataka.

title: World’s first 'half-trillionaire': Elon Musk hits $500B with his ventures
content: Elon Musk has become the first person to achieve a $500 billion net worth, cementing his status as the world's richest individual. This unprecedented milestone is largely due to Tesla's soaring stock, complemented by SpaceX and xAI. His diversified portfolio and visionary leadership continue to reshape industries, with ambitious future targets for Tesla.

title: Women's WC | 'India won't shake hands’: Ex-IND cricketer predicts one-sided win over PAK
content: Ahead of the India-Pakistan Women's World Cup clash on October 5, former cricketer Saba Karim declared India clear favourites, dismissing Pakistan as a true rival. He highlighted India's superior skill, spin strength, and team depth. Karim also confirmed the Indian team will not shake hands with Pakistani players, mirroring the men's team's stance, emphasizing focus on cricket despite the current political situation.

title: ‘Indian economy resilient, can absorb shocks’: Sitharaman amid 50% US tariffs
content: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman highlighted India's growing economic resilience amid intensifying global geopolitical tensions, asserting the nation is well-equipped to absorb external shocks. She emphasized that current disruptions signify a structural transformation, urging India to actively shape outcomes and ensure inclusivity in new forms of cooperation, leveraging its evolving economic influence.

title: Taylor Swift blames Blake Lively for chaos after Travis Kelce arrest
content: Taylor Swift and Blake Lively's friendship faces strain. A legal battle involving Blake Lively led to Taylor Swift's deposition. A process server's arrest at Travis Kelce's home further complicated matters. Swift reportedly feels betrayed by these events. She now prioritizes safeguarding her relationship with Travis Kelce. The future of their high-profile friendship remains uncertain.

title: Paul Hughes vs Usman Nurmagomedov 2: Start time, fight card & viewing info
content: Paul Hughes is set for a highly anticipated rematch against the unbeaten lightweight champion Usman Nurmagomedov on 3rd October, 2025, in Dubai's Coca Cola Arena. Their first encounter was a dramatic and controversial affair, fueling expectations for this pivotal title fight. Streaming globally on DAZN, the event features a stacked card.

title: Cyclone-related deaths: govt. announces ex gratia for kin of four victims in North Andhra region
content: A sum of ₹4 lakh each to be given to the families of four persons who lost their lives; Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu asks officials to undertake relief operations with a humanitarian approach

title: Ensure presence of ST students in schools, says DGE
content: As part of this, all schools are mandated to use ‘Sampoorna Plus’ mobile app and portal for accurately recording the attendance of the ST students

title: Dasara fete at Kanaka Durga temple draws record 15 lakh devotees
content: Eleven-day celebrations conclude with Purnahuti and Hamsa Vahanam; temple earns ₹4.38 crore, Bhavani rush swells a day after Vijaya Dasami

title: Telangana records sixth straight year of excess monsoon rainfall
content: There is an increasing trend of excess rainfall in Telangana, which is traditionally a dry, arid zone. This could be a decadal variation in rainfall patterns, says senior weather consultant Y. V. Rama Rao

title: Karnataka govt. sends four SSLC toppers from KREIS to U.K. to provide world-class academic exposure
content: ‘The programme is aimed at encouraging students to set higher academic goals. It will also expose them to the standards of world-class educational institutions and heritage sites linked to Ambedkar’s legacy,’ says Minister Mahadevappa

title: CPI(M) backs HC probe into ‘missing and unauthorised removal’ of Sabarimala temple artefacts
content: When journalists noted that the CPI(M) leader A Padmakumar was the president of the TDB when the panels were taken out of the temple for repair in 2019, Mr. Govindan says the party is under no obligation to protect any wrongdoer. Earlier, TDB President P.S. Prasanth stated that TDB officials in 2019 had, prima facie, erred in allowing private intermediaries to transport the gold coverings to Chennai for repair.

title: Democracy in peril under ‘double engine sarkar’, says CPI(M) leader Raghavulu
content: He accuses the BJP, the TDP, and the YSRCP of making unending attempts to forge wayward alliances to suit their vested interests

title: Veteran journalist T.J.S. George passes away
content: Thayil Jacob Sony George began his career in journalism in the 1950s and went on to hold senior editorial positions in India and abroad

title: Complete Polavaram project works before Godavari Pushkarams in 2027, Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu tells officials
content: The Chief Minister also suggests to the officials to focus on developing the project site as a major tourism destination, and broaches the idea of laying an iconic road linking the project to the national highway

title: Stop terrorism if you want a place in geography, Army chief warns Pakistan
content: General Dwivedi reviews operational readiness in Rajasthan’s Anupgarh, urges soldiers to remain fully prepared for action

title: Procedures for land conversion to be simplified without compromising paddy and wetland protection, says Rajan
content: All applications below 25 cents to be cleared by December 31; special adalats launched to fast-track cases

title: Deaths of children in Chhindwara: Nath blames toxic cough syrups, slams M.P. government over situation
content: Such blatant adulteration in medicines for children went unchecked for a long time, indicating a complete failure of law and order and the administrative machinery in the State, says Senior Congress leader Kamal Nath

title: Floods wreak havoc in North Andhra districts; elderly couple killed in house collapse
content: Heavy rains trigger massive inflows into the Vamsadhara and Nagavali rivers, inundating 9,000 acres of paddy fields. Officials alert residents in low-lying areas of Srikakulam and Vizianagaram and step up relief operations

title: Investigate case against TVK leader Aadhav Arjuna seriously, Madras High Court directs Chennai police
content: Justice N. Senthilkumar says, even a small spark can lead to a disaster and hence the inflammatory tweet must not be taken lightly

title: Picture of contrast: Deficient in south, surplus in north, Southwest Monsoon averages out as ‘normal’ in Karnataka
content: Reflective of the uneven spatial distribution of rains, several districts of north Karnataka, which were on the deficient side till the first week of September, ended the season with excess

title: Namma Clinics fails to meet its objective of supplying free medicines to senior citizens in Bengaluru: Survey
content: Beneficiaries say they get medicines only for about 15 days in a month, and clinics run out of supply after that; the survey argues that nurses dispensing medicines at the clinics are not trained properly

title: CPI(M) accuses a ‘weakened’ UDF of scrambling for Muslim fundamentalist votes in crucial election year
content: State secretary M.V. Govindan accuses UDF of Jamaat-e-Islami Hind as a crutch to prop up its election fortunes. Jamaat’s youth movement, Solidarity Youth Movement, employs ‘extreme Islamist iconography’ and re-launched its agenda of revanchist Islamic revivalism in Kerala, he says

title: Launch of ‘Auto Drivers’ Sevalo’ scheme in Andhra Pradesh on October 4
content: A sum of ₹15,000 will be credited to the bank accounts of 2,90,669 beneficiaries annually under the scheme; to avail of it, the drivers should hold valid driving licence and vehicle registration in Andhra Pradesh

title: Bihar Govt announces DA hike for employees, pensioners
content: Deputy CM Samrat Choudhary, who is in charge of the Finance Department, said the "festival gift" from the government would cost the State exchequer an additional ₹917.78 crore in the current financial year

title: Fiscal trends indicate Kerala can stabilise debt while setting examples for taking development goals and fiscal responsibility together, says new research paper
content: Research paper looks at the State’s debt profile in the context of recently published CAG report, which suggests that Kerala’s fiscal position may not be as precarious as earlier feared

title: Internal bickering in Congress resurfaces as govt approaches midway mark of tenure next month
content: Sources in the Congress maintained that the party’s central leaders are expected to take a decision on both issues — Cabinet reshuffle and leadership change — after elections in Bihar in November

title: BJP names Aditya Sahu as Jharkhand working president
content: Rajya Sabha MP from OBC Baniya community replaces Ravindra Rai; move seen as part of organisational reshuffle

title: Railway under bridge renovated in 50 days in Nellore
content: Long-pending repair at Ramalingapuram completed with a cement concrete road, culvert and footpath at a cost of ₹1.17 crore, easing waterlogging woes

title: BJP-JD(S) alliance firm and will continue into all elections, says Deve Gowda
content: Former PM says his party is focused on the organisation and has set itself a target of winning at least 50 to 60 seats in the forthcoming civic polls in city

title: From dropout crisis to model campus: Karnataka headmaster turns village school into success
content: Headmaster Narayanaswamy R. a government school teacher from Bashettihalli in Doddaballapur taluk in Bengaluru turns village school into success.

title: DMK has no moral right to blame the Centre: Nainar Nagenthran
content: BJP leader accuses Stalin of diverting people’s attention to hide the incompetence of the DMK administration

title: Kerala woman gets a ‘thank you’ from Gaza
content: Sreereshmi Udayakumar arranged a 3,000-litre water truck to make the supply to around 250 Palestinian families

title: Raut claims 'betrayal' as he slams Sena leader Kadam's remarks on Bal Thackeray's death
content: Making such statements amounted to betrayal of Balasaheb Thackeray, says Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Sanjay Raut

title: Bombay HC dismisses Anil Ambani's plea against SBI classification of his account as fraud
content: The SBI had last year classified the accounts as fraud, alleging misappropriation of funds by entering into transactions that violated the terms of loans extended by it

title: Karur stampede: Madras High Court constitutes SIT, condemns TVK leaders for ‘abandoning’ victims
content: Justice N. Senthilkumar orders that the SIT should be headed by Inspector General of Police Asra Garg

title: ECI briefs Central Observers for Bihar Assembly elections
content: CEC urges Observers to act as “eyes and ears” of the Commission, ensure impartial conduct of elections

title: NHAI to install QR code signboards with project-specific information on National Highways
content: The vertical QR Code Sign Boards will provide project-specific information, including National Highway number, highway chainage, contact numbers for highway patrol, toll manager, resident engineer, and emergency helpline 1033, NHAI said in a statement

title: Rahul Gandhi promoting the agenda of ‘anti-India forces’, says BJP
content: BJP spokesperson Sudhanshu Trivedi’s comments follow Rahul’s latest remarks at a university in Colombia about the ‘wholesale attack on the democratic system’ in India. Saying that the Congress has many experts in different fields, he asks what ‘talent’ the Leader of the Opposition has deserving invitation by foreign universities.

title: BRS and its MLA did little for Jubilee Hills constituency, elect a ‘young, local’ candidate: MIM chief Owaisi
content: As parties, including BRS, seek to reach out to the Muslim community, the Hyderabad MP urged people to vote for a ‘local, young’ candidate

title: Pakistan must be held accountable for its horrific human rights violations: India on crackdown on protesters in PoK
content: Several areas in Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir have witnessed widespread protests with people demanding basic rights, justice and an end to what they described as systemic oppression

title: CEC, ECs to visit Bihar, review poll preparedness on October 4-5
content: The term of the 243-member Bihar Assembly ends on November 22 and polls in the State are likely to be held in multiple phases

title: KPCC’s cultural wing to hold two-day south zone camp in Alappuzha
content: Around 350 delegates from Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta, and Alappuzha districts are expected to participate

title: No clarity on why 3.66 lakh additional voters were deleted: CPI(ML) Liberation’s Dipankar Bhattacharya
content: Dipankar Bhattacharya said lack of clarity in the final electoral roll published for Bihar, ahead of the Assembly polls in the State, is a matter of concern

title: Beach nourishment with dredged sludge mitigates coastal erosion in West Kochi within Kochi Corporation limits
content: However, Cochin Port Authority officially denies depositing dredged sludge along the coast, a long-standing demand of erosion-affected coastal population in Chellanam

title: SIT concludes journalist Rajiv Pratap's death a road accident due to intoxication
content: Deputy Superintendent of Police Janak Panwar said that on September 18, Pratap, along with his former student and cameraman Manbir Kaluda, went to meet Chief Constable Soban Singh, posted at the police lines. The three then proceeded to the market and a taxi stand, where they consumed alcohol till around 10 p.m..

title: India anchor of stability in volatile world: RBI Governor
content: Sanjay Malhotra attributed the country's strong fundamentals to low inflation, good foreign exchange reserves, a narrow current account deficit, and the very strong balance sheets of our banks and corporates

title: Not thinking about retirement, focusing on strengthening my mind: Deepika Kumari
content: “I’m trying to master every technique. In the past, I have often struggled mentally during crucial matches in tournaments, which has cost me results.”

title: Silence is a sign of victory, says Gobichettipalayam MLA Sengottaiyan on call for AIADMK unity
content: On his supporters being relieved of party posts, he remarked, “More may be removed, but everything will ultimately turn out for good.”

title: Malaysian delegation offers to invest up to ₹10,000 crore in Amaravati
content: Malaysian delegation expressed interest investing in Amaravati over the next five years in tourism and hospitality, education, trade and  commerce and real estate sectors

title: Retrieving Katchatheevu alone will permanently resolve issue of fishermen arrests, but Union govt. uncooperative: T.N. CM Stalin
content: With the Tamil Nadu Assembly elections due next year, the BJP and its leaders have begun descending on the State, Mr. Stalin said. He warned that the people of Tamil Nadu should remain vigilant and not be swayed by such tactics.

title: Chandra Sekhara Reddy appointed EESL national adviser
content: A. Chandra Sekhara Reddy has also been mandated to specially focus on Mission LiFE (Lifestyle for Environment), the flagship initiative of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, launched at COP26, which emphasises sustainable lifestyles

title: India lifts export ban on de-oiled rice bran
content: Edible oil industry body SEA had earlier urged the government to lift the ban on exports to protect domestic processors and enhance farmers' income

title: Arookutty houseboat terminal in Alappuzha, built 5 years ago, finally set to become operational
content: Though the main structure was completed, the absence of supporting facilities and repeated failure to find contractors left the terminal unused

title: In 24 hours, Kanha Reserve loses popular 'Balaghat Male Tiger', two cubs
content: For the last couple of days, the tiger had been hanging around in the buffer area, and possibly wandered into the core area, landing in the territory of another big cat that killed it, an official said

title: Heavy rains pose flood threat to Srikakulam, Vizianagaram districts
content: Heavy inflows are being expected into those rivers with heavy rains in their catchment areas of Andhra Pradesh-Odisha border

title: Ravana Effigy's Face Refuses To Burn During Dussehra Celebrations In Kota
content: A towering Ravana effigy, erected to be burnt as part of Dussehra celebrations, stood with its face intact even after the rest of it was set ablaze in Kota, Rajasthan.

title: Premium Brands May Be Available In All Liquor Stores In Delhi Soon
content: Delhi could soon see a fresh excise policy being implemented, with the draft expected to be ready within a month.

title: Alaskan Climber Falls To Death From Yosemite's El Capitan During Livestream
content: A popular Alaskan climber fell to his death from Yosemite National Park's El Capitan, marking the third death in the park this summer.

title: Gautam Adani Thanks "Every Hand, Heart" That Worked On Navi Mumbai Airport
content: Days before the Navi Mumbai International Airport will be inaugurated, Adani Group chairman Gautam Adani walked through its premises and met the staff that worked on it and will manage it.

title: Rain, Winds Push Delhi AQI To 'Satisfactory' Post-Dussehra
content: A combination of rainfall and steady winds helped Delhi avoid a sharp rise in pollution levels following Dussehra celebrations on Thursday, with the city recording improved air quality on Friday.

title: "Was Asked For Nudes": Akshay Kumar Reveals Daughter's Horror In Online Game
content: Bollywood actor Akshay Kumar on Friday shared a disturbing real-life incident that involved his 13-year-old daughter playing a video game to highlight the growing threat of cybercrime among children.

title: 16-Year-Old Boy Drowns During Durga Idol Immersion In Ayodhya: Cops
content: The immersion of a Durga idol turned tragic in Ayodhya district when a 16-year-old boy drowned after slipping into a pond, police said on Friday.

title: MK Stalin Slams BJP For "No Genuine Concern" Over Karur Stampede
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M K Stalin on Friday accused the BJP and the government led by it at the Centre, of "showing no genuine concern" over the tragic stampede in Karur.

title: Election Commissioners To Visit Patna To Review Poll Preparedness
content: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar and Election Commissioners Vivek Joshi and S S Sandhu will visit Patna for two days beginning Saturday to review poll preparedness in Bihar, officials said.

title: Soldiers Fulfil Role Of Brother At Woman's Wedding, Guests Watch With Tears
content: In a deeply emotional moment, soldiers in Himachal Pradesh fulfilled the role of a brother at the wedding of a woman whose brother was killed in action in Arunachal Pradesh. Visuals showed many at the wedding stood with tears.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Saudi-Pakistan Defence Pact Is Not About Them, But Someone Else
content: This defence pact - if it does indeed exist or is to be rolled out in its entirety - is aimed at different actors in Asia: West Asia, India, China and even Russia , even while the US rakes in the money.

title: Congress Leader Says There Was 'Something Amiss' About Op Sindoor, BJP Hits Back
content: Stirring up a controversy, a senior Congress leader has implied there was something amiss about Operation Sindoor, which was India's response to the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam.

title: High Court Rejects Anil Ambani's Plea Against SBI's Fraud Tag For Accounts
content: The Bombay High Court on Friday dismissed a petition filed by industrialist Anil Ambani challenging the State Bank of India's (SBI) decision classifying his and Reliance Communications' accounts as fraud.

title: After Trump's Big Praise, Pak Says It Backed Different Version Of Gaza Plan
content: Days after US President Donald Trump praised Pakistani leadership for supporting the Gaza peace deal, Islamabad has denied backing Washington's '20-point' proposal to end the war between Israel and Hamas.

title: Karnataka Man Murdered, Fake Wife Appears To Collect Rs 5 Crore Insurance
content: To claim life insurance of Rs 5.2 crore, a gang killed a partially paralysed man in Karnataka's Hospet, placed his body on a bike and then rammed it with a car to make his death appear like an accident.

title: Woman's Body, Hands And Legs Tied, Found In Blue Drum. "Friend" Drowned Her
content: After two sensational murders this year, involving the now-infamous blue drum, a similar case has emerged from Madhya Pradesh.

title: In Rajasthan, Ramayana Panoramas Have Some Funny Moments
content: Dussehra festivities have ended in Rajasthan, but not without a few laughs as Ramayana panoramas had their funny moments in the state.

title: Why Are Cars Heavier Than Bikes? Rahul Gandhi Explains, BJP Says "Gibberish"
content: Why does a motorcycle weigh 100 kg while a car is much heavier at 3,000 kg? Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi, currently on a trip to Colombia, posed this question to a packed seminar hall in the Latin American country.

title: 11 Seconds, 3 Bullets: UP Man Shoots Friend, Another Films Murder
content: A man lay on the ground as his friend fired three bullets at him within 11 seconds in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut, only to stop when an accomplice recording the incident asked him to "drop it".

title: Vijay's Party Alleges Lathicharge Led To Karur Stampede, Court Orders SIT
content: A lathicharge by the cops led to the stampede that killed 41 people last weekend in Tamil Nadu's Karur district, actor-turned-politician Vijay's party, the Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam or TVK, told the Madras High Court Friday.

title: Bills' 'Cold Front' Rivalry uniforms, Bucs and Seahawks' throwbacks top Week 5 threads
content: the Buffalo Bills will rock their all-white "Cold Front" threads against the new England Patriots on "Sunday Night Football" there's a chrome, iridescent charging buffalo on the sleeves and a buffalo as a helmet decal .

title: The latest buzz: More on the Ravens’ struggles, Titans' trauma and potential QB trades
content: the "Get Up" crew discusses what's gone wrong with the Ravens this season . insiders Jeremy Fowler and Dan Graziano have been making calls to sources around the league . they are also diving in on the Titans' 0-4 start and long-term ramifications of it .

title: Air Force's alternate uniforms inspired by F-16 headline top threads for Week 6
content: the threads will be worn for the first time Saturday as air force faces a fellow service academy . the uniforms' connection with the F-16 is extensive, with tributes to the fighter jet everywhere from the helmet to the pants . details on the jersey include two patches for the player's name .

title: An all-time hater and a rivalry like no other: The Mannings vs. Florida
content: the longhorns have been a part of America's football consciousness for nearly 60 years . only one of the family's college football rivalries has included a spelling test, years of shade, and has spanned generations . the haters-in-chief, then as part of the redemptive end to the first college football run, was there .

title: Women's Bracketology: UConn projects as top overall seed with one month to season
content: a month before the 2025-26 season opens, there's a fresh look at what may look like . if we last forecasted the bracket in April, the UConn Huskies had just been crowned champions . it's the big news as we enter the final months before the season .

title: 'He fought too many times': How the loss to Ankalaev forced Pereira to change
content: former middleweight and then-light heavyweight champion Alex Pereira complained about how he felt ahead of his title defense . pereira surrendered the light heavyweight championship to Magomed Ankalaev by unanimous decision in an eff . he is now one of the world's most dominant champions of all time .

title: Haaland on pace to surpass Messi and Ronaldo's best seasons. Is that good for City?
content: pep Guardiola was trying to verbalize what made his team so different from their competitors . his wingers defended like defensive midfielders, his attacking midfielders facilitated the central runs of his wales . he said: "we play leftist football"

title: Why Alabama could move ahead early against Vandy
content: all odds by ESPN BET No. 16 Vanderbilt Commodores at no. 10 Alabama Crimson Tide at 3:30 p.m. ET, ABC Line: Alabama -10.5, 3-1 . a 5-0 win over alabama puts the team ahead of the playoffs . it's the kind of matchup that makes you pause before firing a bet .

title: Why Tommy Castellanos sets up FSU for success vs. Miami
content: a storm brewing in Tallahassee, and it's more than just the weather forecast . one team thrives on pressure, while the other thrives in it . what happens Saturday could reshape the entire ACC title race .

title: Inside the Indiana Fever's roller-coaster 2025 WNBA season
content: new: "we have a lot of experience in rallying around teammates," coach says . new: the team's coach says it's a "revolution of faith" in the team . a groin injury in mid-july left the team feeling paralyzed and numb . four other players were lost for the season to injuries .

title: Knicks legends ride camels, 76ers go golfing: Top scenes from Abu Dhabi series
content: the new york Knicks and Philadelphia 76ers are in Abu Dhabi for a preseason doubleheader beginning Thursday . the trip marks the fourth year of the NBA's games in the united arab Emirates . they were greeted with singing from locals and a quick drink .

title: Bama's shot at revenge, high stakes in the ACC and the 29 biggest games of Week 6
content: it feels like we know less about the college football landscape now than we did a month ago . it's into this murky world that we wade for Week 6 . last week boasted serious headliners that clarified the Big Ten's hierarchy .

title: What history tells us about five early-season trends
content: "Get Up" will discuss whether the Cowboys can still reach the playoffs with the "worst defense in football" it's typical to hear a lot about the pace of certain stats . but most of the time when you see "on pace for" stats, you have no idea which teams and players were on pace for similar things in the past .

title: No team has repeated in a quarter century. Are the Dodgers different?
content: the los Angeles Dodgers are 15 games above .500 in the national league division series . a sense of uneasiness lingered in a meeting with manager Dave Roberts . "he was talking to us about the importance of what was in front of us," says infielder .

title: MLB wild-card series: All the action from a packed day of winner-takes-all Game 3s
